feature: Document CI/CD workflow configuration and fix inconsistencies
description: The GitHub Actions deploy.yml workflow references npm commands (npm ci, npm run build) but the project has no package.json. This workflow will fail on every push. The documentation should explain the intended deployment process.

phases.name: Fix GitHub Actions Workflow
phases.description: Update deploy.yml to properly deploy a static HTML site without Node.js/npm dependencies

subtasks.title: Simplify deploy.yml for static site
subtasks.description: Remove Node.js setup, npm install, and npm build steps. Update the workflow to upload the project root directory directly instead of ./dist
acceptance_criteria: Workflow no longer references Node.js or npm
Workflow uploads root directory (.) as artifact
Workflow maintains GitHub Pages deployment functionality

subtasks.title: Verify workflow syntax
subtasks.description: Ensure the updated workflow has valid YAML syntax and follows GitHub Actions best practices

phases.name: Add Deployment Documentation
phases.description: Create documentation explaining the CI/CD workflow and static site deployment process

subtasks.title: Create DEPLOYMENT.md documentation
subtasks.description: Add a DEPLOYMENT.md file explaining the GitHub Pages deployment process, how the workflow functions, and the static site structure
acceptance_criteria: Documents the deployment workflow trigger (push to main)
Explains the static site structure (index.html, images/, docs/, CNAME)

subtasks.title: Add workflow documentation comments
subtasks.description: Add inline comments to deploy.yml explaining each step for future maintainability
acceptance_criteria: Each workflow job has a descriptive comment

phases.name: Verification and Testing
phases.description: Verify the workflow configuration and documentation are complete and correct

subtasks.title: Validate workflow with syntax check
subtasks.description: Run a local validation of the GitHub Actions workflow syntax to ensure it will execute correctly

subtasks.title: Review static site structure completeness
subtasks.description: Verify all static assets are properly included and the site structure is deployment-ready
acceptance_criteria: No missing files that would cause 404s

final_acceptance: GitHub Actions workflow deploys static site without errors
Documentation clearly explains the deployment process
No npm/Node.js dependencies in workflow for static site
